item.title: A new Judas teaser shows the different game environments
item.content:encoded:
Ghost Story Games, the studio founded by BioShock creator Ken Levine, has released a new short teaser for its upcoming FPS Judas. This little teaser shows different environments of The Mayflower, the colony ship that Judas, the main character, lives on. The Mayflower is an environment filled with decades of changes, which Judas has to navigate along with the different relationships which she finds difficult to do.

In the new Judas dev log, the team said, “We put her in a science fiction world, a colony ship filled with robots — a futuristic setting that makes someone like her extremely powerful. But it’s also a world where personal success hinges on how well you can conform to the rules, because dissent would lead to the failure of the mission. That makes her an outlaw, a pariah — a Judas. That tension at the heart of the character came to inform everything about the game, which we stopped thinking of as an FPS and started calling a “Judas Simulator.” Everything comes back to that core idea of you interacting with the world as Judas.”

The Mayflower is split into different sections from VIP Pilgrim Quarters, Regular Pilgrim Dorms, and Violator Quarters with each having its own distinct style. These styles show the divides within a society where the citizens have devolved into a bitter battle of constantly spying on one another and dobbing one another in for even the slightest offences. It’s machines, not people who are in control of business, art, government, and they’re trying to turn the humans into robotic model citizens.

Judas does not have a release date yet, but it is expected for PC, Xbox Series XS, and PS5.

Source: Steam



https://www.thesixthaxis.com/2025/12/02/a-new-judas-teaser-shows-the-different-game-environments/
item.dc:creator: invalid@example.com (ResetEra_Newsbot

item.title: Styx: Blades of Greed has been given a February 2026 release date
item.content:encoded:
Styx: Blades of Greed is going to be released on February 19th 2026, Nacon has confirmed with the game coming to PC, Xbox Series X|S, and PS5. Nacon and Cyanide Studio were originally aiming for a 2025 release date, but the development team needs a few more months to polish the Styx: Blades of Greed experience.

This is the fourth game Styx has appeared in, making his debut in Of Orcs and Men which has led to a now trilogy of games starring the goblin assassin. In this new adventure, Styx is after the new mystical powers provided by quartz, which give him abilities like mind control. These abilities will be used alongside Styx’s shadowy skills and various gadgets to help in his mission to get the quartz.

Styx: Blades of Greed Preview – May the Quartz be with you

In our preview of Styx: Blades of Greed, Stefan said, “It’s genuinely great to see Styx: Blades of Greed bringing the mouthy goblin assassin back for a new generation. The previous games had a scrappy upstart kind of charm to them, and that’s continuing through here, with Cyanide getting more ambitious in how they construct the game into a stealthy playground. Styx might never be a truly revolutionary series, but it’s still plenty of fun, and I’m looking forward to the game’s release later this year.”

Source: YouTube



https://www.thesixthaxis.com/2025/12/02/styx-blades-of-greed-has-been-given-a-february-2026-release-date/
